comment: One of the first professors I have taken and makes an effort to try and get the class interacting through discussion and seminars about current related geopolitical scenarios. Very insightful with her lectures and has a very enthusiastic attitude.

Lectures were very interesting and kept the class engaged, even at 8am. She encourages class discussions and learns everyone's names, which made the class well worth the time. Content wasn't difficult unless you never show up. The professor is brilliant and always willing to talk. Grades are based on discussion posts, but she leaves great feedback

Ose is a very good teacher. Her grading can be a bit tough but it is not unrealistic. Holding students to a higher standard. After each assignment she gives great feedback. All around great class and amazing teacher!

She is great. Very enthusiastic and engaging. She makes learning content in class fun. I wish more teachers were like her.

Just prepare to read! Besides that this class is pretty easy and straight forward.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Accessible outside class

comment: She was a fantastic professor, and as a freshmen, this has been my favorite class so far. She may give off a first impression of being difficult, and also she may seem like a harsh grader at the start, but as the semester goes along it gets easier. She is a very interactive teacher, and is great at lectures so attendance recommended.

i love this class! we have interesting discussions, the professor makes the class interesting and gives awesome feedback on essays. Ur essays are important and most of your  grade so they need to be well researched and rly organized. 

I learned soo much cool stuff in this class i highly recommend everyone to take it
The professor is wonderful. She does nice in class simulations to help understand the material and lectures better. Would take again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: Extremely new and try to avoid if you actually want to learn. Nobody understood the class structure. Assignments depended on randomly selected groups. I stopped attending towards the end since very few things from lectures matter on assignments which by the way  does not make sense.

Professor Ose is a wonderful person, and very easy to talk to. However she is a new teacher, and has yet to master her class schedule/content. You can pass this class with an A, that is, if you get a good group. (You can't pick your group). 4/5 group papers, lectures every class, LOTS of reading. I unfortunately never understood anything.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: The professor is very kind and listens to students answers and discusses important topics
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Entry level class based on grad papers. Only group projects. Instructions very unclear. No one ever knew what was going on, if attendance were not required I would have stopped going week 1.
